ygData.subject: Re: Solon's Song of the Sirens
ygData.msgSnippet: It s much like Bellow or Lament or Consonant Chain.  Single target, you have to recycle it manually.  You can keep a mob charmed a long time, but it s tricky
ygData.messageBody:
It's much like Bellow or Lament or Consonant Chain. Single target, you have
to recycle it manually. You can keep a mob charmed a long time, but it's
tricky to do more than charm it..such as charming it and fighting another.
There's no indication the song has worn off until the mob attacks you again.
You can't keep singing it and increase duration, you have to wait till it
drops then resing it.

Also, with the fairly recent charm changes, you'll find that mobs over 25th
level are immune to it.

You'll get a message saying "Creature too high level to be charmed!"

Unless Geoff sticks a higher level version of it in later, you'll be
charming blues only (and after a while, greens). That gives the song a very
short career span. But it's kinda fun while it lasts.

----- Original Message -----
From: <David.Lynam@...>
To: <eqbards@onelist.com>
Sent: Wednesday, June 02, 1999 4:28 PM
Subject: [eqbards] Solon's Song of the Sirens


>From: David.Lynam@...
>
>Solon's song of the Sirens has been my prime motivation from near the
>beginning to work my musical ass off. Can anyone comment on how this song
>works? I realize that, like most bard songs it has only a 10 - 12 second
>duration, but after it wears off, can you recharm the NPC? For that
matter,
>can you continue to sing at it to ensure that the song's effects never wear
>off? We make horrible pvpers, hard to be killed, but even harder to kill
>the attacker. The best we can do is flee. Can you charm a PC using this
>song?
>
